title: Store-brand cereal swap
description: Switch from brand-name cereal to store-brand: same taste, $3.20 less per box

title: Frozen veggie swap
description: Frozen vegetables are just as nutritious and cost 50% less than fresh

title: Whole chicken swap
description: Buy a whole chicken instead of pre-cut pieces. Learn to break it down — saves $4-5 per chicken

title: Water filter swap
description: Switch from bottled water to a filter jug. Family of 4 saves $40+/month

title: Seasonal produce swap
description: Buy fruits and veggies in season — they're cheaper, fresher, and tastier

title: Coffee at home swap
description: Make your morning coffee at home 4 days/week instead of buying out

title: Lunch prep swap
description: Pack lunch from home instead of buying — even 3 days/week makes a big difference

title: Pizza night swap
description: Homemade pizza night instead of delivery. Kids love making their own!

title: Date night in swap
description: Cook a special dinner at home once a month instead of going to a restaurant

title: Streaming bundle swap
description: Rotate streaming services monthly instead of paying for all at once

title: Library ebook swap
description: Use your library's free ebook app instead of paying for Kindle books

title: YouTube workout swap
description: Cancel the gym and use free YouTube workouts at home

title: Annual plan swap
description: Switch monthly subscriptions to annual plans for 15-30% savings

title: LED bulb swap
description: Replace your 10 most-used bulbs with LEDs — pays for itself in 3 months

title: Smart power strip swap
description: Use smart power strips to eliminate standby power drain from electronics

title: Cold wash swap
description: Wash clothes at 30°C instead of 40°C — modern detergents work fine

title: Air dry swap
description: Line-dry clothes when possible instead of using the dryer

title: Carpool swap
description: Share school runs with another parent — cut fuel costs in half

title: Fuel day swap
description: Fill up on the cheapest day (usually Tue/Wed) using a fuel price app

title: Walk the short trips swap
description: Walk or bike for trips under 2km. Great for the family and your wallet

title: Toy library swap
description: Borrow toys from a toy library instead of buying new ones every month

title: Hand-me-down network swap
description: Set up a kids' clothes swap network with friends and neighbours

title: Free activities swap
description: Replace paid activities with free ones: parks, library, nature walks

title: Birthday present budget swap
description: Set a $15 limit for kids' party presents — get creative, not expensive

title: 48-hour rule swap
description: Wait 48 hours before any non-essential purchase over $30

title: Secondhand first swap
description: Check Facebook Marketplace or charity shops before buying anything new

title: Unsubscribe swap
description: Unsubscribe from all retail emails to stop temptation before it starts

title: Cash envelope swap
description: Use the cash envelope method for discretionary spending categories

title: Cleaning products swap
description: Make your own cleaning products with vinegar, baking soda, and lemon

title: Gift experience swap
description: Give experiences instead of things — museum visits, cooking together, park days

title: Where to Buy: Pantry staples
description: Rice, pasta, flour & canned goods: Aldi/Lidl saves 30-40% vs major supermarkets. Buy in bulk at Costco for even bigger savings on family-size packs

title: Where to Buy: Fresh meat
description: Local butchers often beat supermarket prices by 20% with better quality. Buy family packs and freeze portions for the week ahead

title: Where to Buy: Baby essentials
description: Nappies & wipes: Compare supermarket own-brand vs Aldi's Mamia vs bulk online. Aldi Mamia rated #1 by parents, at half the branded price

title: Where to Buy: Cleaning supplies
description: Discount stores like The Reject Shop and Daiso sell the same cleaning basics for 50-70% less than supermarkets

title: Where to Buy: Kids' clothes
description: Compare: Kmart basics ($5-8) vs Target mid-range ($10-15) vs branded ($20+). For fast-growing kids, Kmart and op shops give the best value

title: Meal cost: Spaghetti bolognese
description: Takeaway: ~$45 for a family of 4. Homemade: ~$12 with mince, pasta, canned tomatoes & veggies. Same taste, fraction of the price. Prep: 30 min

title: Meal cost: Chicken stir-fry
description: Takeaway: ~$50 for 4. Homemade: ~$14 with chicken thighs, frozen stir-fry veg & rice. Even faster than waiting for delivery! Prep: 20 min

title: Meal cost: Fish & chips Friday
description: Fish shop: ~$40 for a family. Oven-baked at home: ~$10 with frozen fish fillets & potatoes. Add mushy peas for the full experience. Prep: 25 min

title: Meal cost: Taco Tuesday
description: Restaurant tacos: ~$55 for 4. At home: ~$15 for mince, taco kit, lettuce, cheese & salsa. Kids love building their own! Prep: 15 min
